snippet: The synagogue, with its curving facade, was designed by William N. Breger, who objected to several changes but came around. Mr. Breger died last month at 92.
abstract: Building Blocks column examines legacy of TriBeCa Synagogue, structure designed by late architect William N Breger; observes that in designing the unusually-curved structure, Breger chose motif of 'eternal flame'; notes that Breger opposed changes to the structure in later years, but eventually embraced them.
lead_paragraph: The synagogue, with its curving facade, was designed by William N. Breger, who objected to several changes but came around. Mr. Breger died last month at 92.

headline.print_headline: TriBeCa Synagogue’s Memorable Building and Its Stubborn Architect
headline.main: TriBeCa Synagogue’s Memorable Building and Stubborn Architect
